text: Amedeo Avogadro (9 August 1776, Turin, Piedmont â€“ 9 July 1856) was an Italian scientist. He is most famous for his contributions to molecular theory. The number of elementary entities (atoms, molecules, ions or other particles) in 1 mole of a substance, , is known as the Avogadro constant. ==References== Category:Italian scientists Category:1776 births Category:1856 deaths Category:People from Turin Category:Italian physicians
title: Amedeo Avogadro
